result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry D. Jones Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $150.00 per month, starting on or before September 1, 2016 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry D. Jones Jr.

defendant.name: Jones, Jerry D., Jr.
defendant.address: 22 Main St, Apt 6, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission form

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sherman.  State moved to amend count 1 to misd. bail jumping.   Granted.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Misdemeanor bail jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(a).   State recommended $200.00 fine, plus costs.   Court ordered: $150.00 fine, plus costs.  DNA sample and surcharge.  Pay @ $150.00 per month, starting on or before 9/1.
PLEAS rescheduled at request of Atty Sherman's office; approved by DA's office.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant appears with counsel Jon Sherman.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Case will be set for plea/sentencing.  Will be set with J.A. by attorney Sherman.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  May leave the State of Wisconsin for the purposes of fighting fires for FEMA and the BIA.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of the time limits for having the preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limits for having the  preliminary hearing.
